call_title: Ways to Bring Ergo to College Students | Reva and Henry | ErgoHack VIII

topics.title: Introduction and Campus Developer Workshop Strategy
topics.summary: Cornell students Reva and Henry introduce their hackathon presentation on bringing Ergo to college campuses. They propose developer workshops at university blockchain clubs with company partnerships, cash prizes, and ERG-based incentives to attract students interested in emerging technologies.

topics.title: Learn-to-Earn Wallet Onboarding Program
topics.summary: Proposal for integrating learn-to-earn lessons into Nautilus wallet downloads, similar to Polygon and Solana programs. The 5-7 minute lessons would include quizzes highlighting Ergo's decentralization, UTXO model, Python compatibility, and features like the Rosen Bridge to ease technical onboarding barriers.

topics.title: College Campus Ambassador and Education Programs
topics.summary: Discussion of expanding Sigmanauts program to college campuses with student ambassadors facilitating Ergo adoption. Includes partnering with existing blockchain clubs for workshops, having Ergo developers present in university courses, and creating BuildSpace-style video tutorials for beginners learning smart contract development.

topics.title: Student Builder Scholarships and Community Support
topics.summary: Proposals for highlighting Ergo's 96% public token distribution, offering builder scholarships to students, featuring student projects in Sunday developer updates, and hosting Discord office hours for dev support. These initiatives aim to create stronger community connections and incentivize student participation in the ecosystem.

topics.title: Summary and Future Engagement Opportunities
topics.summary: Henry summarizes the proposed initiatives focusing on bringing Ergo technology to college students who will dominate the blockchain space in coming years. Both speakers express excitement about Ergo's future and their desire to contribute as college students themselves.
